page.title: 16Changing Times (2)
page.content: Mrs Jones took in washing.She lit a furnace to boil the water and ironed on a table with an iron heated over the fire.She also did casual farm work and remembers the annual Mayfair as the only holiday.They ate very little meat,only rabbit and bacon from the pig,but lots of vegetables and steam puddings. Although unqualified she was always called in for births,illness and laying out.All births took place at home and she would attend the mother while someone walked or cycled to fetch the doctor. Mr Jones dug the graves and rang the death bell at the church. As a child on Sundays she went to church in the morning,Sunday school in the afternoon and church again at night.She walked to the local school and left at age 14.
